## Description {#details}

A &quot;cursor&quot; marking a position within a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/value">Value</a>.

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/json/value">Value</a> is a tree, and this is the path from the root to the current node. This is used to associate errors with particular subobjects.

Definition at line 655 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/json-h">JSON.h</a>.

### report() {#abb341982d84226c17deb044ca13eb048}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::json::Path::report (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringliteral">llvm::StringLiteral</a> Message)</>}>
Records that the value at the current path is invalid.

Message is e.g. &quot;expected number&quot; and becomes part of the final error. This overwrites any previously written error message in the root.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/json-h/#l00662">662</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/json-h">JSON.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/json-cpp/#l00211">211</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/json-cpp">JSON.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
